website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus AIR A01 is a small mirrorless camera that omits an LCD and includes a clip to attach to a smartphone, but there are some inherent drawbacks to its design.
pros: Supports Raw and JPG image capture
cons: Communication lag between camera and phone
Memory card is a pain to access

customer_reviews.title: Too many missed photo opportunities!
customer_reviews.text: My OMD was stolen out of my suitcase on a trip to Cambodia and I decided to replace it with the A01. The camera is just way too slow from the time you power on to shoot and the battery life is way too short on both the camera and the phone to simply leave it on all the time. Secondly I find that it's not stable, is fiddly and doesn't always connect. I'm going back to buy another OMD for everyday use and likely sell this one on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: earachemyeye

customer_reviews.title: cool
customer_reviews.text: this thing is cool because I already have lenses now I have Internet conection for immediately shaveing photos. it takes great quality I think better than my em5 olympus. problems it's slow to turn on for those moments you see some thing great. but it is packable great for biking because it doesn't take up lots of space. incredibly durable. but i would only buy this if I already had some lenses or a camera with Bluetooth capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: I like the camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera, it is quite small, easily attachable to the phone. Phone is being held firmly. I am happy with CCD, photos look good. Problem is that when you buy it from the country it is not officially available you have a problem with software for you mobile device, because both Android and iOS apps have limited country availability. There are also minor issues with connectivity, sometimes image on a screen is freezed for a few seconds, sometimes it disconnects and needs rerun. For nerds there is a big plus of SDK and detailed documentation to create own app for using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice addition to my telescope and interesting if you like to the pictures with your vintage lenses
customer_reviews.author: Philippe Reichen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is very cool! The setup process need to be improved, but is not that bad. The lenses and the sensor are very good, you can take very nice pictures from it. Also need to be improved is its operation, that is very sluggish sometimes, at the point of become unusable for a short period of time, which can be VERY frustrating if you lose that special moment, but for the specific use I'm applying it, it is awesome. The possibilities of uses and angles you can compose your shots is something to be pointed out, because of its size and the fact it is wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos I.

customer_reviews.title: small and light but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Camera of very good quality, small and light but powerful (JPG/RAW, braketing, auto manual exposure...), with a good sensor micro 4/3, improved for my DIY motorized pano head or to take photographs on a big pole (whith Wifi control it's very easy) and why not for air videos with a drone.
customer_reviews.author: BEAU François

customer_reviews.title: Compact and takes great photos. My wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Compact and takes great photos. My wife loves it. One down side is that it lags at transferring pictures when there is wireless/wifi connection interference.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am no longer interested in my E-620. The experience of shooting with this is amazing. The interface is a bit unstable and it does take time to start the whole thing up. But, you're using a new and interesting form factor, your live view is huge and your pictures are shared as soon as you like.
customer_reviews.author: ShaneFK

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great idea!
customer_reviews.text: This novel camera is beautifully built and solid,and certainly performs well. It cries out for us to try new things with it, taking advantage off its unobtrusiveness, lack of shutter vibration, and the ability to control it remotely. I hope that Olympus will eventually upgrade the software so we do not have to play with both wifi and Bluetooth. So far I have used it with Olympus 45mm f1.8, the 12-50mm zoom and 12-40mm f2.8 zoom, and focus is quick and accurate, and the photos are as good as from my OM-D. It works equally well with iPad and iPhone. Next it goes on a telescope, but that needs more time.
customer_reviews.author: 14carbonman

customer_reviews.title: Nice little compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Slower than a standard camera but more compact and user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Masa city

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera hardware however instructions from Olympus could use some improvement. Not recommended for photography newbies....
customer_reviews.author: John Shade

customer_reviews.title: Great New Product from Olympus
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. With the addition of the Air A01 to my camera stable I can now travel with a high quality camera with out all the bulk. Use it on business trips and jib sites when I need everything to fit into the brief case. Also, like the idea that whenever I need more lenses I can attach any of my Olympus or Panasonic 4 thirds optics on to A01.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I already had two Olympus lenses that work with it
customer_reviews.author: Ralph W. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Concept very good, response camera to phone or tablet somwhat slow
customer_reviews.text: You have to get used to it... Bought now also more compact lenses, as the older lenses look out of proportion. The every time pairing/syncing with the phone and tablet is somewhat slow, if you need the camera fast, you are too late.... Hopefully this can be solved with a future software update. Though like the concept very much. Will be taking it on a holiday trip in the coming weeks and will find out how well it goes. Camera needs also a small tripod, got myself a small Manfrotto, believe this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Willem

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Has to return this, it wouldn't connect to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: James M Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: The linking speed is much faster than QX100, and ...
customer_reviews.text: The linking speed is much faster than QX100, and the quality of image have advanced one step than EM10. the 1/16000s shutter is just for my DG42.5. If the software can conclude more ways to take photo, and all apps would takes a RAW files, that's perfect
customer_reviews.author: KiraZ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The lens is okay. But the app needed to work with the lens is typical Olympus; s***!!
customer_reviews.author: Math Meertens

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: didn't like operation. didn't like video limits. videos record loud lens adjustment sound when focusing
customer_reviews.author: pizza lover

customer_reviews.title: No good if you live in Europe
customer_reviews.text: No good if you live in Europe. You can not download the software from Olympus if you live in Europe. For me I just threw the cash out the window. Dissapointed at Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... you can not replace the it so it's no good. not good thinking on the Olympus
customer_reviews.text: It's a throw away camera once the Battery goes you can not replace the it so it's no good. not good thinking on the Olympus
customer_reviews.author: D. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Way too high for the limiting factors.
customer_reviews.text: The pricing makes no sense. Why would I pay the full price for a DSLR but with far fewer options? $499 for this product is outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: GreenNerd

product_meta.title: Olympus Air A01 Black (-Body Only)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Body OnlyNew concept camera which provides intuitive controls for shooting, image manipulation, and uploads to social media through a linked smartphone.
feature_bullets: Equipped with a Micro Four Thirds lens mount for a large selection of available lens options
Up to 1/16,000 second shutter speed at 10 frames per second
Instant Connection and image sharing via Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connection
Comprehensive OA Central app with six different shooting applications
Integration with Amazon Cloud Drive makes it easy to upload your photos to the cloud and access them anywhere
